cs303
Class Data

java.lang.Object
  cs303.Data

public class Data
extends java.lang.Object

A data-handling class. Reads files (of integers). Produces random arrays.

Method Detail

read

public void read(java.lang.String fileName,
                 int[] values)
Reads a file containing a list of integers, one per line. To be used when the number of integers in the file is known.

Parameters:
fileName - the file name to read
values - int array correctly sized to number of integers in file

read

public int[] read(java.lang.String fileName)
Reads a file containing a list of integers, one per line. To be used when it is unknown how many integers are in the file.

Parameters:
fileName - the file name to read
Returns:
int array of values read from file

write

public void write(java.lang.String fileName,
                  int[] array)
Writes to a file an array of integers, one per line.

Parameters:
fileName - the file name to write to
values - int array of values to write, one per line

getRandom

public int[] getRandom(int size)
For producing arrays of random values, suitable for testing sorting functions at different values of N. For large values of size, duplicate values are probable.

Parameters:
size - Size of array to produce (i.e. N)

getRange

public int[] getRange(int stop)
For producing arrays of ordered values from 0 (inclusive) to stop (exclusive), suitable for testing sorting functions at different values of N.

Parameters:
stop - End value of range (exclusive)
Returns:
int array of values

getRange

public int[] getRange(int start,
                      int stop)
For producing arrays of ordered values from start (inclusive) to stop (exclusive), suitable for testing sorting functions at different values of N. start must be less than stop.

Parameters:
start - Start value of range (inclusive).
stop - End value of range (exclusive)
Returns:
int array of values

getRevRange

public int[] getRevRange(int size)
For producing arrays of reverse ordered values from size-1 down to 0, suitable for testing sorting functions at different values of N.

Parameters:
size - Size of array to produce (i.e. N)
Returns:
int array of values

getRandRange

public int[] getRandRange(int size)
For producing arrays of ordered values from random starting value (inclusive) to that value + size (exclusive).

Parameters:
size - From random start to random start + size
Returns:
int array of values

getQueries

public void getQueries(int[] array,
                       int[] queries,
                       double outPct,
                       int[] truth)
For producing arrays of query values suitable for testing search algorithms.

Parameters:
array - Array from which the queries will come. Assumed to be non-decreasing.
queries - Query array. Length of array determines the number of queries to produce.
outPct - Percentage (as double [0..1]) of queries to be misses
truth - Ground truth array. If queries[i] is in array, truth[i] is the index int array of queries[i], otherwise truth[i]==-1.
